1.text: Slice a papaya in half and scoop out the seeds.

2.text: Add 1 tablespoon (15 g) of papaya seeds to a smoothie.

3.text: Scatter raw seeds over food for a spicy garnish.

4.text: Blend papaya seeds to make Hawaiian papaya seed dressing.

5.text: Make a flavorful marinade for chicken, steak, or pork.

6.text: Mix papaya seeds with vinegar and spices to make hot sauce.

7.text: Cut a papaya in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds.

8.text: Rinse the seeds under cold water.

9.text: Preheat the oven to 150 °F (66 °C) and spread the seeds on a sheet.

10.text: Bake the papaya seeds for 2 to 4 hours.

11.text: Grind the seeds and use the powder in place of ground black pepper.

12.text: Mix ground papaya seeds with spices to make a flavor rub.

13.text: Try baking with ground papaya seeds.
